context_bundle.summary: Psychological assessment: Reliability (test-retest, internal consistency, inter-rater), validity (construct, criterion, content), standardization, norming, intelligence testing (WAIS, WISC), personality assessment (Big Five, MMPI).

onboarding.quick_start: Reliability is necessary but not sufficient for validity. Standardized administration essential. Norms must match population. Multiple methods reduce bias. Test what the test measures, not what it's called.
common_patterns: Reliability: Test-retest (stability), internal consistency (Î±>.70), inter-rater (agreement between scorers)
Validity: Content (covers domain), criterion (predicts outcomes), construct (measures intended construct)
Intelligence: g-factor debate, fluid vs crystallized, WAIS-IV (adults), WISC-V (children)
Personality: Big Five (OCEAN) - trait approach, MMPI - clinical/validity scales
known_errors: Teaching to the test - inflates scores without improving construct
Ignoring confidence intervals - point estimates misleading
Cross-cultural bias - norms may not generalize
Over-interpreting subscale differences - need reliable difference
